original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 6908.
    Returns: the ratio of his lifting total to bodyweight.
    """
    # L1
    initial_total_pounds = 2200 # powerlifting total of 2200 pounds
    total_gain_percent = 0.15 # gain 15% on his total
    total_added_pounds = initial_total_pounds * total_gain_percent

    # L2
    new_total_pounds = initial_total_pounds + total_added_pounds

    # L3
    initial_bodyweight_pounds = 245 # bodyweight of 245 pounds
    bodyweight_gain_pounds = 8 # 8 pounds of body weight
    new_bodyweight_pounds = initial_bodyweight_pounds + bodyweight_gain_pounds

    # L4
    lifting_to_bodyweight_ratio = new_total_pounds / new_bodyweight_pounds

    # FA
    answer = lifting_to_bodyweight_ratio
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: He added {initial_total_pounds}*{total_gain_percent}=<<{initial_total_pounds}*{total_gain_percent}={total_added_pounds}>>{total_added_pounds} pounds to his total
That means his new title is {initial_total_pounds}+{total_added_pounds}=<<{initial_total_pounds}+{total_added_pounds}={new_total_pounds}>>{new_total_pounds} pound total
His new body weight is {initial_bodyweight_pounds}+{bodyweight_gain_pounds}=<<{initial_bodyweight_pounds}+{bodyweight_gain_pounds}={new_bodyweight_pounds}>>{new_bodyweight_pounds} pounds
So he has {new_total_pounds}/{new_bodyweight_pounds}=<<{new_total_pounds}/{new_bodyweight_pounds}={lifting_to_bodyweight_ratio}>>{lifting_to_bodyweight_ratio} for his ratio
